data: West | Southwest | Uncle Sam | Kansas | Fort Larned | Pacific

One summer morning, in the sixties, when the Indians in the West and Southwest were still giving much trouble to Uncle Samâ€™s settlers and soldiers, and when the great railway lines were being pushed forward across the continent to the Pacific coast, a scout rode across country in Kansas from Fort Larned to another military post, about sixty miles distant.
Buffalo Bill Among the Sioux; Or, The Fight in the Rapids
